intro: Heloniopsis kawanoi, commonly known as Kawano's heloniopsis, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Iridaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it blooms in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
